text: The American Academy of Pediatrics recommends that children be screened for risk factors of ASD at 18 and 24 months of age. At regularly scheduled well-child visits, parents of young children may be given a screening tool, called the Modified Checklist for Autism in Toddlers, Revised (M- CHAT-RTM) to help identify warning signs of ASD.
